<title level="1" right="Rules">[Turns](/Rules.aspx?ID=2427)</title>

**Source** [Player Core](/Sources.aspx?ID=216) pg. 435 <sup>2.0</sup>

<row gap="medium">
<column gap="medium" flex="1 1 400px">
When it’s your turn to act, you can use single actions (<actions string="Single Action" />), short activities (<actions string="Two Actions" /> and <actions string="Three Actions" />), reactions (<actions string="Reaction" />), and free actions (<actions string="Free Action" />). When you’re finished, your turn ends and the character next in the initiative order begins their turn. Sometimes it’s important to note when during your turn something happens, so a turn is divided into three steps.
</column>

</column>

</row>
